Johnson''''', 303 U.S. 77 (1938) is a case in which the [[Supreme Court of the United States|United States Supreme Court]] dealt with corporate entities. The case involved whether the state of California could levy a tax, on a company licensed to do business in that state, for transactions that occurred in a different state. [[Harlan F. Stone|Justice Stone]] delivered the opinion of the Court.
